overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto's social media presence spans across Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, with a total follower count of 3580. Engagement is driven by discussions of computational social science, disinformation, and research opportunities. LinkedIn posts, particularly about research grants, generate high engagement, indicating a strong professional interest from his audience.

contentThemes.description: Posts frequently discuss methodologies and findings related to disinformation across social media platforms.
Opportunities for postdoctoral researchers and PhD students are often highlighted, attracting engagement.
Announcements related to conferences and upcoming presentations are common.

recommendations: Increase frequency of posts related to research opportunities to engage academic followers.
Leverage LinkedIn's professional network by sharing detailed insights and case studies from research projects.

platformInsights.mastodon: Engagement is moderate with posts on methodological discussions and tool updates. Increasing interaction with followers could enhance engagement.
platformInsights.linkedin: High engagement on LinkedIn is driven by professional updates and research grants. Continue to focus on academic and research content here.
platformInsights.bluesky: Content related to published papers and conference presentations performs well. Consider sharing more detailed insights and interactive content.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.
Just published our new paper on coordinated inauthentic behavior on social media platforms!
Our team has just released v2.0 of CooRnet, with improved algorithms for detecting coordinated link sharing behavior.
